Author: orryvsworld
Text: my best/closest friend struggles with an ED as well. i will find myself pointing out all of her lies to herself and trying to rationalize them with her. i will try to convince her she is worth more than a number, i look at her and i think she’s beautiful and has been regardless of all weight changes, but for some reason, i am worth exactly as much as the number on the scale. i don’t understand why it’s so easy to tell someone else what to do but so hard to tell yourself. it almost causes as much pain as the ed does to argue with yourself. for me the thing i will miss least about having an ed is feeling like i have two different brains that argue with each other constantly. i literally have a rational personality, and a disordered personality, and they just sit there and disagree with each other and it’s exhausting. i don’t even care if i gain or lose as much as i just wish i didn’t have to think about it

Author: isthised
Text: It’s easier to care for others than to care for ourselves. We look at people and we see them from an outsiders perspective. We look at ourselves and we see all the guilt and shame and hurt that we’re carrying around and it’s hard to see ourselves as deserving of love and care.
